description:
**Tool Overview**:

The .NET Cumulative Updates are designed to include all previous updates in a single package, streamlining the installation process for system administrators.

**Details**:

When deploying .NET updates, it is essential to understand that these updates are chained, meaning that installing a later or higher version will supersede the previous versions automatically. This method is similar to Windows cumulative updates, ensuring that the system retains only the highest version of updates after installation. Utilizing the supersedence metadata allows for efficient patch management, reducing the complexity of tracking and applying individual updates. By following the .NET cumulative update chaining approach, administrators can ensure their environments are always up to date with minimal effort.
